title: User authenticated but not connected (outlook)
content:
I use an older hotmail account with thunderbird and it works perfectly fine. I needed to set up a new account, but with the new outlook account I get the User authenticated but not connected.

I found a few posts about this, but their fix does not work. disabling ipv6 in config editor

I am using the defaults, port 993 OAuth2 SSL/TLS

I have tried disabling ipv6 but that does not fix the problem. Don't know if Microsoft changed something with the newer accounts. Is there anything else I can do? the other posts I found about this were... https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1399126

title: Thunderbird displaying 24 hr time format.  Linux Elementary OS configured 12 hr time format.
content:
Thunderbird Version: 128.3.3esr (64-bit) Elementary OS 7.1

Email messages received all display in 24 hour format. The calendar is also in 24 hour format. Elementary is configured for AM/PM (per the GUI), and displays as such within the OS. This is a brand new installation of both the OS and Thunderbird.

I'm all about RTFM and performing due diligence before asking... but this has me stumped. Largely because I keep running across documentation calling out various strings intl.date* in the Thunderbird configuration. Problem is my instance does not contain a single string containing intl.date. "Date" excludes all searches.

Below is one such document referencing these strings. https://enterprise.thunderbird.net/manage-updates-policies-and-customization/thunderbird-preferences-enterprise/customize-thunderbirds-date-and-time-formats

Any assistance is appreciated.

title: Problem accessing iCloud email after using CCleaner
content: I have purchased CCleaner Professional to help improve the start-up time on my laptop. I probably overdid the cleaning and I must have changed a setting of how Thunderbird performs. I have an email account with Apple and I also use Apple for my Thunderbird calendar source. I have an iPhone so that's why I use Apple for email and calendar. (I also have a GMail email account and that's working fine in Thunderbird.) To access my Apple email and calendar in Thunderbird I need to provide an "App Specific Password" which I can download from Apple. I have used this in the past for Apple applications on my Windows PC and laptop without any problems. On my laptop, when I try to access my Apple email or calendar, I'm asked for my App Specific Password. I have created new App Specific Passwords for both my email and calendar but, having entered these in Thunderbird, I still don't have access to new entries in my email or calendar. I can see existing entries but I can't create new ones. When I enter a new calendar event on my phone, it doesn't appear in Thunderbird. If I could, somehow, repair the fault that CCleaner seems to have made in Thunderbird, I would prefer to do that. If anyone knows how to make this repair, please let me know. Another solution might be to delete Thunderbird completely from my laptop and reinstall it. A clean reinstall would probably take the App Specific Passwords as I originally entered. I also have a Windows desktop PC with Thunderbird installed that that's working fine with Apple email and calendar. I haven't use the CCleaner professional on that! My options seem to be: 1. Repair Thunderbird to remove the problem that I created by destroying part of it by using CCleaner. or 2. Deleting Thunderbird from my laptop and start again with a fresh install. If I delete Thunerbird from my laptop, will it affect how Thunderbird works on my PC? Sorry for this essay. If anyone has any suggestions, I would be grateful for your advice. Thanks for you patients if you managed to keep awake while reading this tome. Gary Mail. GFW.Design@GMail.com
creator: gfw.designs

title: Three Gmail accounts, each with different Bin/Trash folder(s)
content: I've just (yesterday) done a new install of Windows 10, and re-installed Thunderbird which has just updated itself to version 128.4.0esr (64-bit) and says it is up to date. Thunderbird handles four accounts for me, three of them Gmail. Each of those three has been set up differently with respect to Bin/Trash (not by me; I just let Thunderbird do all that). One of them has a Bin folder and a Trash Folder, one of them has just a Bin folder, and one of them has just a Trash folder. What is going on here and how can I fix it so they all have just one, and all called the same (I don't really care which but I'd have a UK preference for Bin!) Screenshot shows two of the accounts; folder proliferation prevents me including the third but take my word for it that the one not shown has a Trash folder!
creator: spargeus.maximus

title: Solicitud de soporte para configuración LDAP en versión móvil de Thunderbird
content:
Buen día,

Actualmente utilizo Thunderbird en mi dispositivo móvil para gestionar mi cuenta de correo laboral. En la versión de escritorio, tengo configurado un Servidor de Directorios (LDAP) propio de la empresa que facilita el acceso a las direcciones de correo de todos los empleados. Sin embargo, he notado que esta funcionalidad no está disponible en la versión móvil, lo que representa una limitación significativa, ya que desde mi celular no puedo acceder a los contactos de la empresa a menos que los tenga previamente agendados.

Me gustaría saber si existe alguna opción para habilitar LDAP en la app móvil, o si están considerando incluir esta funcionalidad en futuras actualizaciones. Esto sería de gran utilidad para mejorar la eficiencia en la comunicación laboral desde dispositivos móviles.
creator: marinita6999

title: Pop3Client not sending QUIT message
content:
hi Recently TBird has been downloading some emails repeatedly, and on inspecting the Pop3Client log in the console it appears that in these instances it is not sending the QUIT message.

Correct behaviour: 19:02:45.695 pop3.server2.477: C: DELE 1 Pop3Client.sys.mjs:573:20 19:02:45.705 pop3.server2.477: S: +OK Marked to be deleted. 19:02:45.898 pop3.server2.477: Folder lock released. Pop3Client.sys.mjs:1371:22 19:02:45.898 pop3.server2.477: Done with status=0x0 Pop3Client.sys.mjs:1616:18 19:02:45.965 pop3.server2.477: C: QUIT Pop3Client.sys.mjs:573:20 19:02:46.063 pop3.server2.477: Connection closed. Pop3Client.sys.mjs:447:18 19:02:46.064 pop3.server2.477: S: +OK Logging out, messages deleted.

Failure - email remains on server: 09:59:24.571 pop3.server2.277: C: DELE 1 Pop3Client.sys.mjs:573:20 09:59:24.594 pop3.server2.277: S: +OK Marked to be deleted. 10:00:10.314 pop3.server2.277: Folder lock released. Pop3Client.sys.mjs:1371:22 10:00:10.315 pop3.server2.277: Done with status=0x0 Pop3Client.sys.mjs:1616:18 10:00:10.409 pop3.server2.277: Connection closed. Pop3Client.sys.mjs:447:18

Any ideas on what is causing the missing QUIT message? Note the 40s gap before the folder lock release - could that be related? At this point TBird usually has a spinning cursor and says Not Responding in the title bar.

cheers mark

title: Urgent: Suddenly not receiving emails
content:
I don't understand why I am not receiving any emails today. There is some kind of disconnect between my webmail and Thunderbird because the webmail is working fine. I can send messages through Thunderbird but can't receive anything at all.

I asked my hosting company to help and they wrote back... 

your email device is not sending any login details. So the error means it is not connecting successfully. The last couple log entries that show your device makes it to the server but does not supply any login details. As the authentication error is coming from the device there is nothing I can change on this end to resolve the issue. I would suggest fully restarting the email device or removing and adding the account to the email device again. Please ensure you have a backup of any data before removing and adding the account.

I have had this account for years without any problem. I don't understand what's happening and I can't understand any of this techspeak. I did try closing and reopening Thunderbird but there is no change. At first Thunderbird wanted to update and failed, and then finally succeeded but still the email problem exists. Please help urgently thanks

title: Problemi con le mail crittate
content:
Salve è una piccola serie di problemi relativamente recente di cui io sono venuto a conoscenza oggi ma apparentemente alcuni miei colleghi lo riscontrano da circa 1/2 mesi quindi è un problema magari relativo alla versione 128.x.x.

Su 3 dispositivi diversi (ho fatto anche un po' di debugging controlli etc., inoltre tutti i dispositivi hanno la stessa versione del sistema operativo, versione di thunderbird etc.). ho 3 problemi leggermente diversi ma tutti collegati solo ed esclusivamente dall'utilizzo di mail crittate infatti e come ho menzionato prima di 1/2 mesi fa funzionavo sempre perfettamente. I 3 casi sono questi: 1. Il software di Thunderbird si pianta completamente per qualche minuto quando si prova a aprire una mail crittata, non ci mette solo di più come dovrebbe solitamente. 2. Il messaggio arriva ma senza gli allegati, esportando però l'email e decirfandola esternamente gli allegati sono presenti quindi solo thunderbird non gli riconosce, la mia chiave privata e la chiave pubblica del mio collega però l'ho scaricata direttamente da thunderbird. 3. Arriva la mail crittata coi allegati e si può scaricarli etc. ma non si riesce più ad aprirli direttamente dall'email come si poteva fare precedentemente.

Sapete darmi una mano ?
creator: pawel.resolvo

creator: jacques-gerome

title: Info gestione calendario condiviso
content:
Buongiorno, ho creato un calendario condiviso con Aruba e l'ho sincronizzato con il calendario di Thunderbird (128.4.0esr) utilizzando ICS. Io non ho messo in sola lettura il calendario sulle varie postazioni così che possa inserire degli eventi da ovunque. Il problema è che le persone che hanno la possibilità di vedere il calendario (e modificarlo) una volta ricevuto l'invito possono modificare anche il calendario di salvataggio e quindi poi toglierlo dal calendario condiviso (per esempio sul calendario personale). In pratica io vorrei che il calendario condiviso possa essere utilizzato da tutte le postazioni dove l'ho creato in modo da poter creare e modificare eventi, l'unica cosa vorrei che uno possa modificare il calendario di salvataggio quando riceve l'invito. Spero di essermi spiegato bene, grazie in anticipo e buona giornata

Manuel
creator: manuel7wlf

title: Cannot send emails
content:
Hi,

I've setup Thunderbird (32 bit) on Windows 8.1 client on Hyper-V. This is a setup I've used on 2 other machines with no problems as long as I run the 32-bit version. I currently have a similar Hyper-V setup on my laptop (Windows 11 host/Windows 8.1 client/Thunderbird 32-bit) with no issues.

On this machine (Windows 10 host/Windows 8.1/Thunderbird 32-bit) however, I can receive emails fine but can only send 1 message and then no more. I've followed all of the online suggestions, and I can even ping the smtp.google.com servers and it works fine. Web browsing works fine (upload, download). It also works fine on the Windows 10 host, as there are no problems sending/receiving using Thunderbird from there.

I know this is a little out of normal use, but in my case, I have older 32-bit software that I have to virtualize because the activation servers were shut down last year. So, I run on a 15-use "trial" since I can't activate my "owned" software anymore. When I run out of trial uses, I create a new virtual machine, reload the software, restore my backup file and I'm off and running again.

Anyway, any clues of where to look would be appreciated.

content:
Why do I get this alert message across the bottom of my screen when I double-click to open an email in my INbox? It is in a yellow box across the bottom of a pre-populated draft 'return to the sender" email.

A unique identity matching the From address was not found. The message will be sent using the current From field and setting from identity Robert Hill <arnilmmproductions@gmail.com>"

It doesn't mark the original email as 'Read' when I close it. But if I right click on it, it gives me the option of opening it a new Tab, a new Window, or a Conversation.

The problem seems to recur after a Thunderbird upgrade.

Hoping to get your response and a solution soon. Thank you.
creator: ArnilMM

title: Problem recovering Thunderbird email, address book
content:
Recently our hard disk failed so I did a complete OS replacement. In the process I upgraded from Lubuntu 22.04 LTS to 24.04 LTS. I think I was able to recover the old profile, and copied it to the new drive but the new version of Thunderbird (V128.3.1) is not able to access the old email folders or address book. Our old version of Thunderbird could so it wasn't a preexisting problem.

Examination of the error console revealed two error messages. The first, with its attendant details: NS_ERROR_FAILURE: Couldn't decrypt string crypto-SDR.sys.mjs:197 

   decrypt resource://gre/modules/crypto-SDR.sys.mjs:197    _decryptLogins resource://gre/modules/storage-json.sys.mjs:1032    findLogins resource://gre/modules/storage-json.sys.mjs:788    findLogins resource://gre/modules/LoginManager.sys.mjs:469    getRefreshToken resource:///modules/OAuth2Module.sys.mjs:143    _init resource:///modules/OAuth2Module.sys.mjs:136    _initFromPrefs resource:///modules/OAuth2Module.sys.mjs:85    initFromMail resource:///modules/OAuth2Module.sys.mjs:37    loadStartFolder chrome://messenger/content/messenger.js:770    InterpretGeneratorResume self-hosted:1417    AsyncFunctionNext self-hosted:804

The second: Uncaught NS_ERROR_FAILURE: Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIMsgMessageService.messageURIToMsgHdr] 

   displayMessage chrome://messenger/content/aboutMessage.js:173    openTab chrome://messenger/content/mailTabs.js:326    _cloneTemplate chrome://messenger/content/mailTabs.js:65

22 aboutMessage.js:173 

   displayMessage chrome://messenger/content/aboutMessage.js:173    openTab chrome://messenger/content/mailTabs.js:326    _cloneTemplate chrome://messenger/content/mailTabs.js:65

I have seen descriptions of similar problems that were solved by removing several files in the default profile directory: cert9.db, key4.db, logins.json and pkcs11.txt. In my case this did not work. I add that I didn't really delete them, I simply added ".xx" to the end of each file name.

My current version of Thunderbird is able to receive and send email messages so the problem appears to be some issue with the old profile. It's possible that some file(s) in the old profile is/are damaged, but running the Repair application (1) did not generate any error messages and (2) did not fix the problem.

I'd appreciate any suggestions/hints on where to go from here.
creator: markkimball51

title: Displaying number of emails/items in a local folder
content: Hi, Before this latest udate i have 128.4.0esr (64-bit) all my local folders showed the number of unread messages in them. Now some do and some dont. I am not a computer wizard so simple step by step directions/suggestions to resolve this issue would be appreciated Thank you Stephen
